content:
Hi, WG-llvm!

What do you think is the status of #91190 (compile time regression due to the new LLVM pass manager)? Should the newPM be disabled altogther with #91189 (beta-backported in #91263) or has another solution appeared in the meanwhile to avoid doing this (and its complications)?
I'm referring to this bit from the T-compiler discussion.

#91190 is scheduled for discussion in T-compiler this week, so I'm trying to gather in advance some feedback to help drive the discussion forward, thanks!
(apologies if I'm missing something obvious about the discussion)
I know @Nikita Popov is still looking at this in LLVM
I have an upstream patch for this at https://reviews.llvm.org/D115497, so I'm hoping we can resolve this by next week.
cool thanks! I'll note this into the T-compiler agenda
